chargeHist.descr: Homicide by Intoxicated Use of Vehicle

result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnathan T Mueller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Johnathan T Mueller is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges. On one or more other charges, Johnathan T Mueller was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Johnathan T Mueller is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Johnathan T Mueller was found guilty of Homicide by Veh. Use-Control. Substance, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.09(1)(am).
  • Johnathan T Mueller was found guilty of Cause Injury/Operate-Control. Substance (1st) (PAC<0.15), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: of the Sentencing Hearing held on April 12, 2016 before the Honorable Randy R Koschnick

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department and or it's agencies immediately release the defendant's property listed in the appended motion to Mary Mueller, at a time and location to be agreed upon by the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department and Mary Mueller
Acknowledgement of Review by the Court of Letter Submitted by 3rd party

**After review of the Realtime for the 4/12/16 Sentencing Hearing and clarification with the Court, the Clerk's minutes are corrected as follows:

Case called at 9:52 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Johnathan T Mueller in court, in-custody, with Attorney John k Smerlinski. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing arguments by ADA Shock; Letter from Larry & Diane Hosford read by ADA Shock; Letter from Kay Moeller read by ADA Shock; Statement by Doug Cooper; Statement by Chris Rugland; Statement by Christine Cooper; Statement by Mary Mueller; Sentencing arguments by Attorney Smerlinski

On Count #2, the Court sentences Mr. Mueller to 5 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2 years and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3 years. This sentence is to commence forthwith 

The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) or for the Substance Abuse Program. 
The Court gives 75 days credit for time already served

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--No possession or consumption illegal drugs
--No possession of drug paraphernalia
--Random drug/alcohol screening
--AODA Assessment & Follow-through with any recommended treatment, therapy or counseling per Agent
--Either maintain full-time employment or pursue and education program or a combination of the two as directed by Agent
--No possession of dangerous weapons
--Pay the DNA surcharge & submit a DNA sample
--Mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges. 
--5 year revocation of d.l. privileges. 
APPLY CASH BOND-RETURN REMAINDER TO SURETY

On Count #5, the Court sentences the Defendant to 1 year in the Jefferson County Jail, concurrent to Count #2, to be served in the prison system.  The defendant has 75 days credit for time served.
--$300 fine + costs to be converted to a civil judgment.
--Mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharge to be converted to a civil judgment. 

Court directs Atty Smerlinski to talk to the DA and law enforcement regarding the return of personal items
Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Recess: 11:24 am

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 9:52 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Johnathan T Mueller in court, in-custody, with Attorney John k Smerlinski. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing arguments by ADA Shock; Letter from Larry & Diane Hosford read by ADA Shock; Letter from Kay Moeller read by ADA Shock; Statement by Doug Cooper; Statement by Chris Rugland; Statement by Christine Cooper; Statement by Mary Mueller; Sentencing arguments by Attorney Smerlinski

On Count #2, the Court sentences Mr. Mueller to 5 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2 years and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3 years. This sentence is to commence forthwith 

The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) or for the Substance Abuse Program. 
The Court gives 75 days credit for time already served

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--No possession or consumption illegal drugs
--No possession of drug paraphernalia
--Random drug/alcohol screening
--AODA Assessment & Follow-through with any recommended treatment, therapy or counseling per Agent
--Either maintain full-time employment or pursue and education program or a combination of the two as directed by Agent
--No possession of dangerous weapons
--Pay the DNA surcharge & submit a DNA sample
--To pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges
APPLY CASH BOND-RETURN REMAINDER TO SURETY

On Count #5, the Court sentences the Defendant to 1 year in the Jefferson County Jail, concurrent to Count #2, to be served in the prison system
--To pay costs of $443; to be convered to to civil judgment
--75 days credit for time served
--$300 fine + costs to be entered into civil judgment
--5 year license revocation

Recess: 12:38 pm Reconvene: 1:07 pm Court/Counsel review instructions - New instruction 484 provided to counsel
Jury Enters: 1:13 pm

Closing arguments by ADA Shock (1:14 - 1:29 pm)

Rebuttal Closing arguments by ADA  (2:05 - 2:14 pm)
The Court instructs the Jury (2:14 - 2:47 pm)
Deputy Matt Kanters is sworn as the Jury Bailiff.
The alternate juror is selected through the tumbler system; Juror #2079 is excused from the Jury. 
The Jury retires to deliberate at 2:49 pm Exhibits #4, -#9 - #18, #20 - #34 & #39 are provided to the Jury for use during deliberations
Recess: 2:55 pm Reconvene: 4:08 pm in response to Jury question
Court/Counsel discuss juror question (marked as Court Exh#8) provide agreed upon answer
off-record: 4:13 - 4:28 pm to research instructions
Recess: 4:33 pm - pm: Jury returns with its Verdict.

The Jury finds Mr. Mueller not guilty of Count #1, Homicide by Intoxicated Use of Vehicle
The Jury finds Mr. Mueller guilty of Count #2, Homicide by Use of Vehicle with a Detectable Amount of a Restricted Controlled Substance
Count #3, Homicide by Negligent Operation of a Vehicle - No Verdict
The Jury finds Mr. Mueller not guilty of Count #4, Operating While Intoxicated Causing Injury 
The Jury finds Mr. Mueller guilty of Count #5, Operating with a Detectable Amount of a Controlled Substance Causing Injury

The Court polls the Jury; their responses confirm the written verdict form.
Jury Exits: 5:25 pm; ADA Shock orally motions for the Court to accept the verdicts and enter judgments.
Atty Smerlinski orally motions for judment of aquittal not withstanding verdict; Court denies

The Court receives the Verdict, on Count #1, finds Mr. Mueller not guilty and orders Judgment of Acquittal entered.
The Court receives the Verdict, on Count #2, finds Mr. Mueller guilty and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
Court dismisses Count #3 without prejudice
The Court receives the Verdict, on Count #4, finds Mr. Mueller not guilty and orders Judgment of Acquittal entered.
The Court receives the Verdict, on Count #5, finds Mr. Mueller guilty and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
State orally motions to revoke bond; Arguments presented
Court revokes bond and remands him to the custody of the Sheriff pending sentencing
State requests PSI - Court orders PSI to be completed in 60 days, with sentencing in 75 days
Recess: 5:30 pm 

NEXT:  (1) Schedule Sentencing Hearing in 75 days - Send notices **Atty Smerlinski to contact the Court's JA 1/29/16 for scheduling**

Case called at 1:41 pm [Clerk SH] (Final Status Scheduling Conference/Motion Hearing)
Defendant Johnathan T Mueller in court with Attorney John k Smerlinski. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Smerlinski informs the Court that matter will proceed to trial; negotiations have been exhausted

Atty Smerlinski informs the Court that it may be a good idea to have a Ludwig hearing so the last known offer can be put on the record
ADA Shock informs the Court that last offer has been made to the defense
Court reviews Ludwig - 124wi2.600 1985; Court reviews constitutional rights with Mr. Mueller
ADA Shock recites plea offer of the State; Mr. Mueller confirms that he understands what the State's offer is and that he makes the decision on whether or not to accept a plea offer
Counsel agree the Court has covered all areas for Ludwig analysis

Upon questioning of Atty Smerlinski, ADA Shock indicates that they should have case in by end of Wednesday at the longest
Court informs Atty Smerlinski to have witness available by 1:00 on Wednesday

Court orders:
2 alternates; 5 strikes each
jurors may take notes and ask questions - over objections of defense
No Miranda Goodchild Hearing Needed - All statements have been provided to defense

On Defendant's Motion in Limine to Limit the Blood Test Presumption
Response by Atty Smerlinski to ADA Shock's analysis
Counsel stipulate that expert testimony is required to establish impairment but not presence
Court informs parties that if something comes up that will take longer than 15 minutes to address - contact the court
Court informs parties of general timing for trial and procedure; 
Atty Smerlinski raises concerns on picking jury; informs Atty Smerlinski that he can request jury clerk to add 10 more panel members to jury panel
Recess: 2:25 pm

NEXT:  Trial to proceed as scheduled - Court's JA to inform Counsel if case is not to proceed as scheduled by Noon 1/20/16
State's Response to Defendant's Motion IN LIMINE to Limit the Blood Test Result Presumption  under WI STATS 885.235
State's notice of intent to orrder expert testimony at trial #1, trial #2 & trial #3
Notice of intent to admit statements made by the defendant

The Court's JA contacted the attorneys via e-mail on this date to inform them of a conflict the Court has on January 26, 2016.  They were informed that the Jury Trial would begin January 25 and continue on January 27 and possibly January 28, if needed.

Case called at 1:24 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Johnathan T Mueller appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney John k Smerlinski. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient

Service of Complaint admitted; DOB & address confimed accurate; charges/penalties recited; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 

Court requires a $2500 CASH bond, with conditions:
--Defendant to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  Defendant to report for SCRAM installation in Room 230 of the Jefferson County Courthouse on .  **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**
-Absolute sobriety
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
-No possession of drug paraphernalia without valid prescription
-No presence in bars, taverns or package houses
-No discussion of the facts of the case with citizens EEI and DMG
Recess: 1:32 pm 

NEXT: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 4/15/15 at 3:20 pm - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 5/1/15 at 10:30 am - Send notices
